io.elegie.luchess.core.domain.moves

Class AbstractFigurineMove

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elegie.luchess.core.domain.entities.Move
      • io.elegie.luchess.core.domain.moves.AbstractMove
        • io.elegie.luchess.core.domain.moves.AbstractFigurineMove
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractFigurineDirectionalMove, AbstractPawnMove, KingMove, KnightMove

    public abstract class AbstractFigurineMove
extends AbstractMove
    A figurine move is a move made by a figurine. The figurine should be passed to the constructor.

      AbstractFigurineMove(Figurine figurine)

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void apply(Color color, Position position)
      We use a generic algorithm to apply the move onto a given position.
      boolean canApply(Color color, Position position)
      Checks whether a move can be played on a given position, for a given Color.
      void cleanDisambiguation(Color color, Position position)
      Given a position and color, update the set disambiguation of the move, keeping only minimal information.
      protected boolean ensureTargetAvailable(Color color, Position position)
      Makes sure that the move can be made onto the target location, i.e the target should be either empty, or occupied by an non-king enemy piece (pending capture).
      Figurine getFigurine() 
      protected abstract java.util.List<Vertex> getPossibleSources(Color color, Position position)
      Implementations are supposed to calculate and return all possible source vertices for the move, using the rules for the implied figurine, with the given position and known move properties.
      java.lang.String getUncheckedValue()
      Constructs a value for the move, appending figurine, disambiguated coordinates if any, capture if any, and target coordinates.

    • Method Detail

      • getFigurine

        public Figurine getFigurine()

      • getPossibleSources

        protected abstract java.util.List<Vertex> getPossibleSources(Color color,
                                        Position position)
        Implementations are supposed to calculate and return all possible source vertices for the move, using the rules for the implied figurine, with the given position and known move properties.
        Returns:
        A list of vertices to be disambiguated from.
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - When no source vertex could be found, given all provided parameters.

      • getUncheckedValue

        public java.lang.String getUncheckedValue()
        Constructs a value for the move, appending figurine, disambiguated coordinates if any, capture if any, and target coordinates.
        Specified by:
        getUncheckedValue in class AbstractMove
        Returns:
        the text representation of the move, without the check mark.

      • apply

        public void apply(Color color,
         Position position)
           throws IllegalMoveException
        We use a generic algorithm to apply the move onto a given position. First, we make sure that the target location of the move is available, then we execute the move, removing the piece from the original location, and putting it onto the target location.
        Specified by:
        apply in class Move
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the player playing the move.
        position - Position upon which the move is played.
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - When the current position does not allow the move. For instance, the move may refer to some invalid square (e.g. an empty square, while we would expect to find the piece we want to move or capture).

      • canApply

        public boolean canApply(Color color,
               Position position)
        Description copied from class: Move
        Checks whether a move can be played on a given position, for a given Color.
        Specified by:
        canApply in class Move
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the player about to play the move.
        position - Position upon which the move should be played.
        Returns:
        True when the move can safely be applied, false otherwise. Further trying to apply a move upon a position which does not allow it will generate a IllegalMoveException.

      • cleanDisambiguation

        public void cleanDisambiguation(Color color,
                       Position position)
                         throws IllegalMoveException
        Given a position and color, update the set disambiguation of the move, keeping only minimal information. Trimming the disambiguation is useful because it used to generate the string representation of the move.
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the move being played.
        position - Position upon which the move is being played.
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - When the disambiguation data are illegal with this position.

      • ensureTargetAvailable

        protected boolean ensureTargetAvailable(Color color,
                            Position position)
        Makes sure that the move can be made onto the target location, i.e the target should be either empty, or occupied by an non-king enemy piece (pending capture).
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - When the move cannot be made.
